001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
005import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
006import java.time.Instant;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.function.Supplier;
010
011import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
012
013import io.jstach.rainbowgum.KeyValues.MutableKeyValues;
014import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.Builder;
015import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.Router;
016
017/**
018 * A LogEvent is a container for a single call to a logger. An event should not created
019 * unless a route or logger is actually enabled.
020 *
021 * @author agentgt
022 * @apiNote LogEvent is currently sealed
023 * @see LogMessageFormatter
024 */
025public sealed interface LogEvent {
026
027        /**
028         * Creates a log event.
029         * @param level the logging level.
030         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
031         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
032         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
033         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
034         * @return event
035         * @see LevelResolver
036         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
037         */
038        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
039                        KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
040                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
041                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
042                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
043                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
044
045                return new DefaultLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
046                                throwable);
047
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Creates a log event.
052         * @param level the logging level.
053         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
054         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
055         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
056         * @return event
057         * @see LevelResolver
058         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
059         */
060        static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
061                        @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
062                return of(level, loggerName, formattedMessage, KeyValues.of(), throwable);
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Creates a log event.
067         * @param level the logging level.
068         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
069         * @param message the unformatted message.
070         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
071         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
072         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
073         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
074         * @return event
075         * @see LevelResolver
076         * @see LogMessageFormatter
077         */
078        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
079                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1) {
080                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
081                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
082                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
083                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
084                return new OneArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
085                                messageFormatter, null, arg1);
086        }
087
088        /**
089         * Creates a log event.
090         * @param level the logging level.
091         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
092         * @param message the unformatted message.
093         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
094         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
095         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
096         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
097         * @param arg2 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
098         * @return event
099         * @see LevelResolver
100         * @see LogMessageFormatter
101         */
102        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
103                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) {
104                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
105                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
106                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
107                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
108                return new TwoArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
109                                messageFormatter, null, arg1, arg2);
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Creates a log event.
114         * @param level the logging level.
115         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
116         * @param message the unformatted message.
117         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
118         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
119         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
120         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
121         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
122         * @return event
123         * @see LevelResolver
124         * @see LogMessageFormatter
125         */
126        public static LogEvent ofArgs(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
127                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object[] args) {
128                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
129                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
130                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
131                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
132                return new ArrayArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
133                                messageFormatter, null, args);
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Timestamp when the event was created.
138         * @return instant when the event was created.
139         */
140        public Instant timestamp();
141
142        /**
143         * Name of the thread.
144         * @return thread name.
145         * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
146         */
147        public String threadName();
148
149        /**
150         * Thread id.
151         * @return thread id.
152         */
153        public long threadId();
154
155        /**
156         * The logging level. {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#ALL} and
157         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#OFF} should not be returned as they have
158         * special meaning.
159         * @return level.
160         */
161        public System.Logger.Level level();
162
163        /**
164         * Name of logger.
165         * @return name of logger.
166         */
167        public String loggerName();
168
169        /**
170         * Unformatted message.
171         * @return unformatted message
172         * @see #formattedMessage(StringBuilder)
173         */
174        public String message();
175
176        /**
177         * Appends the formatted message.
178         * @param sb string builder to use.
179         * @see LogMessageFormatter
180         */
181        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb);
182
183        /**
184         * Appends the formatted message.
185         * @param a appendable to append to.
186         * @see LogMessageFormatter
187         * @throws UncheckedIOException if an IOException is thrown by the appendable.
188         */
189        default void formattedMessage(Appendable a) {
190                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
191                formattedMessage(sb);
192                try {
193                        a.append(sb);
194                }
195                catch (IOException e) {
196                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
197                }
198        }
199
200        /**
201         * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
202         * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be returned.
203         */
204        public @Nullable Throwable throwable();
205
206        /**
207         * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
208         * @return key values.
209         */
210        public KeyValues keyValues();
211
212        /**
213         * Freeze will return a LogEvent that is safe to use in a different thread. Usually
214         * this entails copying the data or checking if it is already immutable. Freeze should
215         * be called before passing an event to an {@link LogPublisher.AsyncLogPublisher}.
216         * @return thread safe log event.
217         */
218        public LogEvent freeze();
219
220        /**
221         * Freeze and replace with the given timestamp.
222         * @param timestamp instant to replace timestamp in this.
223         * @return a copy of this with the given timestamp.
224         */
225        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp);
226
227        /**
228         * A builder to create events by calling {@link Router#eventBuilder(String, Level)}.
229         * <strong>{@link #log()}</strong> should be called at the very end otherwise the
230         * event will not be logged.
231         */
232        public sealed interface Builder {
233
234                /**
235                 * Timestamp when the event was created.
236                 * @param timestamp time the event happened.
237                 * @return this.
238                 */
239                public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp);
240
241                /**
242                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
243                 * @param argSupplier supplier will be called immediatly if this event is to be
244                 * logged.
245                 * @return this.
246                 */
247                Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier);
248
249                /**
250                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
251                 * @param arg maybe null.
252                 * @return this.
253                 */
254                Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg);
255
256                /**
257                 * Sets the message formatter which interpolates argument place holders.
258                 * @param messageFormatter formatter if not set
259                 * {@link LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter#SLF4J} will be used.
260                 * @return this.
261                 */
262                public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter);
263
264                /**
265                 * Name of the thread.
266                 * @param threadName name of thread.
267                 * @return this.
268                 * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
269                 */
270                public Builder threadName(String threadName);
271
272                /**
273                 * Thread id.
274                 * @param threadId {@link Thread#getId()}.
275                 * @return this.
276                 */
277                public Builder threadId(long threadId);
278
279                /**
280                 * Unformatted message.
281                 * @param message unformatted message.
282                 * @return unformatted message
283                 */
284                public Builder message(String message);
285
286                /**
287                 * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
288                 * @param throwable exception at the time of the event.
289                 * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be
290                 * returned.
291                 */
292                public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable);
293
294                /**
295                 * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
296                 * @param keyValues will use the passed in keyvalues for the event.
297                 * @return key values.
298                 */
299                public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues);
300
301                /**
302                 * Will log the event with the current values.
303                 * @return true if accepted.
304                 */
305                public boolean log();
306
307        }
308
309}
310
311final class LogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
312
313        private final LogEventLogger logger;
314
315        private final Level level;
316
317        private final String loggerName;
318
319        private Instant timestamp = Instant.now();
320
321        private String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
322
323        private long threadId = Thread.currentThread().threadId();
324
325        private String message = "";
326
327        private @Nullable Throwable throwable;
328
329        private KeyValues keyValues = KeyValues.of();
330
331        private @Nullable List<Object> args = null;
332
333        private LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter = LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter.SLF4J;
334
335        LogEventBuilder(LogEventLogger logger, Level level, String loggerName) {
336                super();
337                this.logger = logger;
338                this.level = level;
339                this.loggerName = loggerName;
340        }
341
342        @Override
343        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
344                this.timestamp = timestamp;
345                return this;
346        }
347
348        @Override
349        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
350                this.threadName = threadName;
351                return this;
352        }
353
354        @Override
355        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
356                this.threadId = threadId;
357                return this;
358        }
359
360        @Override
361        public Builder message(String message) {
362                this.message = message;
363                return this;
364        }
365
366        @Override
367        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
368                this.messageFormatter = messageFormatter;
369                return this;
370        }
371
372        @Override
373        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
374                this.throwable = throwable;
375                return this;
376        }
377
378        @Override
379        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
380                this.keyValues = keyValues;
381                return this;
382        }
383
384        @Override
385        public Builder arg(Object arg) {
386                var list = this.args;
387                if (list == null) {
388                        list = this.args = new ArrayList<>();
389                }
390                list.add(arg);
391                return this;
392        }
393
394        @Override
395        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
396                return arg(argSupplier.get());
397        }
398
399        @Override
400        public boolean log() {
401                List<Object> args = this.args;
402                if (args == null) {
403                        logger.log(new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
404                                        throwable));
405                        return true;
406                }
407                int size = args.size();
408                LogEvent event = switch (size) {
409                        case 0 ->
410                                new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable);
411                        case 1 -> new OneArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
412                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0));
413                        case 2 -> new TwoArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
414                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0), args.get(1));
415                        default -> new ArrayArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
416                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.toArray());
417                };
418                logger.log(event);
419                return true;
420        }
421
422}
423
424enum NoOpLogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
425
426        NOOP;
427
428        @Override
429        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
430                return this;
431        }
432
433        @Override
434        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
435                return this;
436        }
437
438        @Override
439        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
440                return this;
441        }
442
443        @Override
444        public Builder message(String message) {
445                return this;
446        }
447
448        @Override
449        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
450                return this;
451        }
452
453        @Override
454        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
455                return this;
456        }
457
458        @Override
459        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
460                return this;
461        }
462
463        @Override
464        public boolean log() {
465                return false;
466        }
467
468        @Override
469        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
470                return this;
471        }
472
473        @Override
474        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
475                return this;
476        }
477
478}
479
480enum EmptyLogEvent implements LogEvent {
481
482        INFO() {
483                public Level level() {
484                        return Level.INFO;
485                }
486        },
487        DEBUG() {
488                public Level level() {
489                        return Level.DEBUG;
490                }
491        };
492
493        @Override
494        public Instant timestamp() {
495                return null;
496        }
497
498        @Override
499        public String threadName() {
500                return null;
501        }
502
503        @Override
504        public long threadId() {
505                return 0;
506        }
507
508        @Override
509        public String loggerName() {
510                return "";
511        }
512
513        @Override
514        public String message() {
515                return "";
516        }
517
518        @Override
519        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
520
521        }
522
523        @Override
524        public Throwable throwable() {
525                return null;
526        }
527
528        @Override
529        public KeyValues keyValues() {
530                return KeyValues.of();
531        }
532
533        public int argCount() {
534                return 0;
535        }
536
537        @Override
538        public LogEvent freeze() {
539                return this;
540        }
541
542        @Override
543        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
544                return this;
545        }
546
547}
548
549record OneArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
550                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwable,
551                @Nullable Object arg1) implements LogEvent {
552
553        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
554                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1);
555        }
556
557        public int argCount() {
558                return 1;
559        }
560
561        public LogEvent freeze() {
562                return freeze(timestamp);
563        }
564
565        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
566                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
567                formattedMessage(sb);
568                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
569                                keyValues.freeze(), throwable);
570        }
571
572}
573
574record TwoArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
575                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwable,
576                @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) implements LogEvent {
577
578        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
579                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1, arg2);
580        }
581
582        public int argCount() {
583                return 2;
584        }
585
586        public LogEvent freeze() {
587                return freeze(timestamp);
588        }
589
590        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
591                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
592                formattedMessage(sb);
593                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
594                                keyValues.freeze(), throwable);
595        }
596}
597
598record ArrayArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
599                String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter,
600                @Nullable Throwable throwable, Object[] args) implements LogEvent {
601
602        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
603                messageFormatter.formatArray(sb, message, args);
604        }
605
606        public int argCount() {
607                return args.length;
608        }
609
610        public LogEvent freeze() {
611                return freeze(timestamp);
612        }
613
614        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
615                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
616                formattedMessage(sb);
617                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
618                                keyValues.freeze(), throwable);
619        }
620
621}
622
623record DefaultLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
624                String loggerName, String formattedMessage, KeyValues keyValues,
625                @Nullable Throwable throwable) implements LogEvent {
626
627        public int argCount() {
628                return 0;
629        }
630
631        public KeyValues getKeyValues() {
632                return keyValues;
633        }
634
635        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
636                sb.append(this.formattedMessage);
637        }
638
639        public String message() {
640                return this.formattedMessage;
641        }
642
643        public LogEvent freeze() {
644                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
645                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, mkvs,
646                                        throwable);
647                }
648                return this;
649        }
650
651        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
652                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
653                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, mkvs,
654                                        throwable);
655                }
656                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
657                                throwable);
658        }
659
660}
